title: Drawing, "Design for "Early Warning System" Screen and "Australia" Table", ca. 1987
title_raw: Design for "Early Warning System" Screen and "Australia" Table
medium: Black marking pen, brush and gouache (?), crayon (?), graphite touches on white tracing paper
description: Three panel screen on wheels with left and center panel forming a square, painted blue with map of Europe in black.  At top of left-most panel, a red, zig-zag, halo, at top of right panel, a green target.  Intersecting panels at left is yellow lightning bolt; intersecting at right is orange triangle supported on yellow vertical strut.  Beneath screen is table with black top, in shape of Australia, supported on three green legs.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for "Early Warning System" Screen and "Australia" Table", ca. 1987. Black marking pen, brush and gouache (?), crayon (?), graphite touches on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-100.
